resources.string: Word not saved because it is empty.
Carleton University\n Bachelor of Engineering\n Computer Systems

The two main types of streaming services are Client-Server and Peer-to-Peer. In order to see if a peer to peer streaming service would benefit a streaming service we built a tool that would take in multiple problems about the network and live data. The network would be simulated with a peer to peer streaming service and the result would give results.

My main role in this group project was to create a dynamic network based on the real world dat supplied by our client. The majority of my work was done in C++ and used the Network Simulator 3 framework. I had to read the parsed data line by line and create the respective nodes and links between the nodes based on their IP address.
The outcome of this project was an A on the fourth year project. For the implementation of the simulator as well as the design
